name: Dongding Lin
title: Ph.D. Candidate
location: Hung Hom, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
bio:
I am currently a third-year Ph.D. candidate in the NLP Group at The Hong Kong Polytechnic University, under the supervision of Professor Maggie Wenjie Li. My research focuses on Situated Conversational Recommendation, LLM-based Reasoning, and Multimodal LLMs. Additionally, I am deeply interested in areas such as Speech Generation and Visual Understanding. I am passionate about applying NLP technologies to real-world scenarios, aiming to help people experience the various ways in which AI can enrich their lives.

Prior to my doctoral studies, I earned a Bachelor's degree from Sun Yat-sen University, graduating with a GPA of 3.8/4.0, ranking 37th out of 433 students. I was directly admitted to the Master's program through the postgraduate recommendation and successfully completed my Master's degree, achieving a GPA of 3.9/4.0. During my graduate studies, I was fortunate to be co-advised by Prof. Min Yang at SIAT, Chinese Academy of Sciences.
